intro: Chaetanthera microphylla var. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy surface, and it produces small, clustered fruit capsules. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively low maintenance in suitable climates.
